info.title: OTData API
info.description:
The software-independent standard interface for the transmission of telematics data.
- The authentication is specified by the interface operator
- It is recommended to use OAuth 2.0

hostname.description: Self-hosted Enterprise Server or Enterprise Cloud hostname

tags.name: Tour Management
tags.description: Endpoints to manage tours, drives and shipments

get.summary: Returns a list of data that matches the specified time interval and ID
get.description:
If no ID is specified, data is returned for all vehicles.
If `from` and `to` do not exist, the complete history is returned.

get.summary:
Returns a list of the current data of all vehicles or vehicles that
match the specified ID
get.description: If no ID is specified, data is returned for all vehicles.

get.summary: Returns a list of all matching DDD files of the specified customer
get.description:
If no `did` or `gid` is specified, data is returned for all devices.
If `from` and `to` do not exist, all DDD files are returned.
If `timeused` is set to `activity`, all DDD files needed to cover the given time intervall are returned.

parameters.name: timeused
parameters.description:
Indicates to which time tags `from` and `to` refer:
`"activity"` refers to the time the activities were stored in the DDD Files
`"download"` refers to the download time of the DDD file
`"data"` refers to the time stemp of the DDD files

post.summary: Transmits a list of DDD files

get.summary: Returns a list of all registered devices of the specified customer

post.summary: Sets callback URL for data receiving

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Specifies the type of data to which the callback URL belongs

requestBody.description:
Since there can be only one body parameter, it contains all data that
is transferred in the body and thus also the token. The parameter name
is for documentation purposes only.

get.summary: Returns a list of messages of a specific vehicle
Returns a list of logs that matches the specified time intervall
get.description:
If `from` and `to` do not exist, all logs are returned.
All logs up to `loglevel` are returned.

post.summary: Sets status for a specific message

get.summary: Gets a tour if it has a different entity tag

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: Newest known entity tag of the ressource

put.summary:
Updates or adds a tour under a certain URI if the entity tag in the
`If-Match` header matches the current entity tag on the server.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: Newest known entity tag of the ressource

delete.summary: Deletes a specified tour on a specified device

get.summary: Returns a list of all registered vehicles of the specified customer
Returns a list of all registered drivers of the specified customer
Returns a list of all or a maximum number of events that are in queue

parameters.name: maximum
parameters.description: Maximum number of events to be returned

post.summary: Pushes an acknowledgment for a list of events

requestBody.description: List of Event IDs to be acknowledged

get.summary: Returns list of ETAs for either a certain drive or tour

parameters.name: maximum
parameters.description: Maximum number of ETAs to be returned

versionParam.name: version
versionParam.description: Version of the OpenTelematics API used, e.g.:`"1.1.0"`

fromParam.name: from
fromParam.description: Only data from this point on are returned

toParam.name: to
toParam.description: Only data up to this point in time are returned

otidParam.name: otid
otidParam.description: Registered OpenTelematics ID of the requester

limit.name: limit
limit.description: The limit parameter sets a maximum number of results to return per call.

embed.name: embed
embed.description:
Whether the data of the returned resources should be embedded or whether
only a link should be returned

ifNoneMatch.name: If-None-Match
ifNoneMatch.description: Newest known entity tag of the ressource

ifMatch.name: If-Match
ifMatch.description: Newest known entity tag of the ressource

NoContent.description:
No Content. The server has successfully fulfilled the request and there
is no additional content to return in the response payload body

NotModified.description:
Not Modified. The resource has not been modified since the version
specified by the request header If-None-Match.

BadRequest.description:
Bad Request. The server cannot or will not process the request, due to a
client error.

Unauthorized.description: Unauthorized. The request requires user authentication.

Forbidden.description:
Forbidden. The server understood the request, but refuses to authorize
it.

NotFound.description:
Not Found. The server has not found anything matching the effective
request URI.

InternalServerError.description:
Internal Server Error. The server encountered an unexpected condition
which prevented it from fulfilling the request.

version.description: Version of the OpenTelematics API used, e.g.:`"1.1.0"`

otid.description: Registered OpenTelematics ID of the responder

characteristic.description:
`satellite`: GPS, Galileo, GLONASS etc.
`indirect`: Bluetooth, Wi-Fi etc.

addresstype.description:
Type to distinguish between different types of addresses, so that
you can have several addresses in one list

addition.description: Further address information or additional details

ismandatory.description: Indicates if it is mandatory to notify

value.description: Rotational speed of engine in rpm

items.description: Fuel level primary, secondary, ... tank in %

value.description: Wet tank air pressure in kPa
Fuel used at cruise in liter
Fuel used at drive in liter
Number of idle longer than 5 min
Number of idle longer than 10 min
Time engine is on in sec
Total vehicle distance with cruise control

OTTacho.description:
`workingstate`, `timerelstate`, `cardpresent`, `overspeed`,
`systemevent`, `direction` and `speed` are described and specified as in
SAE J 1939

workstate.description: State of work of the drivers

timerelstate.description:
Indicates if the driver approaches or exceeds working time limits
0=normal / 1=15 min. bef. 4 1/2h / 2=4 1/2h reached / 3=15 min bef. 9h / 4=9h reached / 5=15min bef. 16h / 6=16h reached / 14=Error / 15=n/a

cardpresent.description: Indicates the presence of a driver card

overspeed.description:
Indicates whether the vehicle is exceeding the legal speed limit set
in the tachograph

systemevent.description:
Indicates that a tachograph event has occurred. This may include
power supply interruption, interruption of the speed sensor,
incorrect data on the driver card, driving without a driver card,
illegal removal of a driver card, insertion of a driver card during
driving, and time adjustment

direction.description: Indicates the direction of the vehicle

speed.description: Speed of the vehicle registered by the tachograph

cruisetime2.description: Total cruise time w/o acceleration pedal in sec.

cruisedistance2.description: Total cruise distance w/o acceleration pedal in km

axel.description: axle number front to back beginning with 0

OTTour.description:
Contains all static information about a tour. It consists of a number of
`drives`. For complex tours there are optional structures that contain
data about `shipments`, `items`, `tasks` and dangerous goods.

drivenumber.description: Indicates the position of the drive in a tour

adrtotals.description:
Summarized information about the dangerous goods that are present
during the drive. May be different for each drive.

tasks.description: List of tasks for the stop of the current drive

event.description:
Type of the event. If you just want to transmit information during a
task, use the enum 'info'

status.description:
Information about the status of an item e.g. the condition at
delivery

addresses.description: All addresses relevant for the shipment

items.description: List of all single items of the shipment

parentid.description:
Item ID of the package the item is part of (e.g. the ID of the
palette to which the item belongs). With the `parentid` you are able
to map any tree structure in the item list.

codes.description: List of codes on the item, e.g. barcodes

type.description: Type to distinguish between different types of codes

scanrequired.description: Indicates if the item must be scanned

adrinfo.description:
Information on classification according to the 'Agreement concerning
the International Carriage of Dangerous Goods by Road' (ADR).
Summarized information on the dangerous goods present on each drive
can be found in `OTDrive`

shipmentid.description: The UUID of the shipment the task refers to

used_company_card.description: the company card which was used

data.description: container data bytes encoded in Base64

OTTimestamp.description: Creation time of the data set
